item.title: Personal Projects
item.description: Ongoing CTF Club Challenges As Co-Founder and Vice President of the CTF club on campus, I make CTF challenges for our general meetings and competitions. The challenges range in topic and difficulty, and are designed to introduce members of all skill levels to various cybersecurity areas. 01-2024 Sniffer Python. Sniff a victim’s network traffic by poisoning their ARP cache to redirect all traffic through the attacking system. Looks specifically for unencrypted credentials sent on ports that often run less secure protocols.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Select resources I’ve used to learn and practice skills: Hands-On Hacking Hack the Box VulnHub TryHackMe pwn.college PentesterLab Over the Wire: Wargames Pwnable.tw Root Me Smash the Stack CTFs Awesome-CTF Awesome Penetration Testing CTF Writeups HackTricks ired.team Notes CTF101 PicoCTF CTF Learn RingZer0 CTF Papers and Books Linux Hardening In Hostile Networks: Server Security From TLS To Tor Mastering Linux Security and Hardening Learn Penetration Testing Penetration Testing: A Survival Guide News The Hacker News Bleeping Computer Threatpost Dark Reading Youtubers IppSec LiveOverflow Null Byte John Hammond Network Chuck Misc.

item.title: Study Spaces
item.description: Some of my favorite Boston-area cafes to study in. Perfect for a warm cup of coffee and a soft ambience to get cozy in the terminal for a few hours. Pavement Coffee My go-to spot for a productive morning, nestled conveniently close to campus. Sweet matcha lattes, hearty bagels. Spacious but quickly fills with the gentle hum of studious, socializing college kids. Ogawa Coffee Coming from Japan with their first international shop here, Ogawa undoubtedly serves the best matcha in Boston.

item.title: Welcome,
item.description: My name is Shannon :) I’m a junior studying cybersecurity with a cyber operations concentration at Northeastern University. Here you’ll find a collection of what I’m currently learning, small personal projects, educational resources I’ve found useful, and brief reviews of my favorite Boston-area coffee shops to study in. I’m primarily interested in: + Security Engineering + DevSecOps + Penetration Testing I enjoy crafting secure and resilient code to drive operational efficiencies, address complex security challenges, and fortify evolving cyber landscapes.
